goals: to elevate students’ confidence and motivation to participate in English conversation
to broaden their knowledge pertaining to English conversation
to enhance their skills in conducting English conversation
syllabus:
**The Objectives**: The goal of this course is to enhance students’ English-speaking competence by **broadening their scope** of English conversation and **enhancing their communication skills in real-life situations**. At the same time, it will try to **build confidence** and **motivate** them to **actively participate in English conversation**. In order to do so, there is a **five-pronged approach** to the course this semester:

1.  Firstly, the **course textbook** presents natural language in authentic contexts, and helps **develop conversation management strategies** in order to significantly improve both fluency and confidence.
2.  Secondly, there will be various **supplementary materials**. These will vary over a range of areas and at appropriate times, so that students can to familiarize themselves with topical language spoken in various popular settings.
3.  Thirdly, over the course of the first-half of the semester, students will undertake a **task-based project**, in which task groups, of no more than 4 students per group, are asked to **investigate areas and topics** that are **of interest to them**, and then **present their work** to the class **via film or performance**. Examples include short films (comedy, drama, horror), radio shows (news, weather, interviews, ads), plays (skits, drama, musicals) or shows (music, magic, games).
4.  Fourthly, over the course of the second-half of the semester, students will undertake a second **task-based project**, in which task groups are asked to **investigate areas and topics** that are of interest to them, and then **present their work** to the class via **a conversational PowerPoint presentation.**
5.  **Finally, autonomous learning.** Students should **practice speaking** **English** outside every chance they get. Indeed, all major English-language encounters **should be recorded for** **grading**.

**N.B. All five elements** **will be assessed** when calculating the final grade.

**Guidelines and Requirements: The Rules!**

1.  Punctual attendance is required. Being on time is polite. **Talk to or email me** if you can’t attend class.
2.  **Actively participate** in class discussions.
3.  This is a **Flip Class**. **Homework must be done** for the class to work properly. This includes **reviewing** and **previewing** class chapters.
4.  You need to **submit** drafts or reflections **_several times_** during the semester.
5.  **All Task Journal** **assignments** must be done and be **on time**.
6.  **Smartphones**, tablets, etc, must be **turned off** unless needed in class.
7.  **No eating** during class, but **drinks are allowed.**

**Grading Policy****: The Business!**

**Final Grades** will be given and assessed on student performances in the following areas:

**1)** Attendance + Participation: 20%

**2)** Classroom/Homework assignments: 20% (e.g. show and tell, movie review)

**3)** Performance Task - Task 1: 20% (Presentations, Task Drafts and Reflections)

**4)** Presentation Task - Task 2: 20% (Presentations, Task Drafts and Reflections)

**5)** Autonomous learning: 20%
